intro: Vasconcellea manihot, commonly known as arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces a starchy, tuberous root that is widely used as a thickening agent in cooking. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it both a valuable food crop and an ornamental plant.
